entry.title: REPRESENTATIVE GOODWIN CALLS FOR FULL REPEAL OF MEASURE 110
entry.summary: October 24, 2023 4:00 p.m. State Representative Christine Goodwin is calling for the full repeal of Measure 110. A release from Goodwin said that through Measure 110, Oregon was the first state to decriminalize possession of drugs such as heroin, methamphetamine, cocaine and fentanyl. Goodwin said funding was shifted away from public safety, schools, cities...

entry.title: WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY FOR MOUNTAIN AREAS
entry.summary: October 24, 2023 10:50 a.m. A Winter Weather Advisory is in effect for mountain areas of southern Oregon from 5:00 p.m. Tuesday through 9:00 p.m. Wednesday above 4,000 feet. Forecasters at the National Weather Service said wet snow is expected at elevations as low as 3,500 feet. Total snow accumulations of 2 to 4 inches...

entry.title: I Stand with Palestine rally, peaceful protest against genocide

entry.title: Oregon's original lighthouse still shines
entry.summary: Back in the 19th century, before there were interstate highways and logging trucks, commerce on the West Coast was largely conducted via waterways, especially rivers and the Pacific Ocean.

entry.title: Nearly $50 million in grants to strengthen forest products economy
entry.summary: OREGON — The U.S. Department of Agriculture's Forest Service has nearly $50 million in grant funding available for proposals that will benefit forests, communities and local economies.

entry.title: Woman charged with murder denied pretrial release
entry.summary: Sierra Sioux Jennings, 29, was denied pretrial release and will remain at the Douglas County Jail for her alleged involvement in the murder of 34-year-old Joshua Lynn Alexander.
